equal.description: Adds to the rate of Army Tradition gained each year. [Additive]
Adds to the decay rate of Army Tradition. [Additive]
Modifies the Army Tradition bonus when gained through battles. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the rate of Army Professionalism gained each year. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the army drill gains while drilling [Multiplicative]
Modifies the army drill decay rate per year. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the base cost of infantry units. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the power infantry gain from unit pips. [Multiplicative]

Modifies the base cost of artillery units. [Multiplicative]

Modifies the effectiveness of cavalry flanking. [Multiplicative]
Adds to the bonus artillery get versus forts. [Additive]
Modifies the bonus damage artillery inflict when in the backrow during combat. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the discipline of land units. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the discipline of mercenary units. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the land morale of land units. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the siege defensiveness that affects siege phase length. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the siege ability that affects siege phase length. Reverse concept of defensiveness. [Multiplicative]

Modifies the fire damage taken by land units. [Multiplicative]

Modifies the shock damage taken by land units. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the army morale recovery speed. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the bonus siege status by blockaded. [Additive]
Modifies the morale damage taken by units in reserves (i.e. not in battle, but engaged with another unit) [Multiplicative]
Modifies the attrition taken by land units. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the cost of reinforcements when units are reinforced. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the rate at which units are reinforced with new men. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the rate at which manpower is recovered. [Multiplicative]

Modifies a country's total manpower pool. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the base unit cost for all land units. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the base speed at which land units are recruited. [Multiplicative]

Modifies all building costs. [Multiplicative]
Modifies all building construction times. [Multiplicative]

Modifies the base core creation cost. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the rate at which the cores of a country will decay when under the ownership of a different country. [Multiplicative]

Modifies the monarch power cost of Diplomatic technologies. Generated automatically for all technology tables in common/technology.txt. [Multiplicative]

Modifies the amount of Innovativeness gained [Multiplicative]

Adds to the base rate of prestige decay. [Additive]
Adds to the monthly rate of splendor points. [Additive]
Adds to the yearly rate of corruption. [Additive]
Modifies the base cost of advisors. [Multiplicative]
Adds to the pool size for advisors. [Additive]
Modifies the base chance rate for female advisors. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the base chance for an heir during the heir generation tick. [Multiplicative]
Adds to the base ADM skill a ruler, heir and consort can be generated with. Does not effect rulers created with fixed = yes . [Additive]
Adds to the base DIP skill a ruler, heir and consort can be generated with. Does not effect rulers created with fixed = yes . [Additive]
Adds to the base MIL skill a ruler, heir and consort can be generated with. Does not effect rulers created with fixed = yes . [Additive]
Modifies the cost of hiring an Administrative advisor. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the cost of hiring an Diplomatic advisor. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the cost of hiring an Military advisor. [Multiplicative]
Adds to the yearly base rate of absolutism. [Additive]
Adds to the maximum value of absolutism. Internally absolutism bonuses do not scale above 100. [Additive]
Adds to the maximum number of states a country can support. [Additive]
Adds to the yearly rate of legitimacy. Does not appear or have an effect if a country's government does not use legitimacy. [Additive]
Adds to the yearly rate of republican tradition. Does not appear or have an effect if a country's government does not use republican tradition. [Additive]
Adds to the yearly rate of devotion. Does not appear or have an effect if a country's government does not use devotion. [Additive]
Adds to the yearly rate of horde unity. Does not appear or have an effect if a country's government does not use horde unity. [Additive]
Adds to the yearly rate of meritocracy. Does not appear or have an effect if a country's government does not use meritocracy. [Additive]
Adds to the monthly rate of militarisation for governments with the militarisation mechanic. [Additive]
Adds to the yearly rate of tribal allegiance for governments with the tribal allegiance mechanic. [Additive]
Modifies the impact of Imperial Authority gains. [Multiplicative]
Adds to the rate of Imperial Authority gained per month. [Additive]
Adds to the rate of Mandate gained per month. [Additive]
Adds to the duration of an election cycle for the current nation. Negative values shorten the duration, positive values add to it. [Additive]
Adds to the randomized stats a republican candidate may receive during elections. [Additive]
Modifies the cost in Republican Tradition when re-electing candidates. [Multiplicative]
Adds to the rate of government reform progress gain. [Additive]
Modifies the diplomatic power cost for culture conversion in provinces. [Multiplicative]
Adds to the maximum number of accepted cultures a country can have. [Additive]
Modifies the advisor cost for advisors that share the same culture as the country's court they're in. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the diplomatic power cost for promoting a culture. [Multiplicative]
Adds to the base unrest value. [Additive]
Modifies the administrative power cost of raising stability. [Multiplicative]
Adds to the monthly rate of autonomy in owned provinces. [Additive]
Sets the minimum autonomy level allowed in all owned provinces. [Constant]
Modifies the cooldown for the autonomy reduction and increase buttons. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the military power cost for using harsh treatment. [Multiplicative]
Adds to the base separatism value of provinces when conquered. [Additive]
Modifies the minimum autonomy experienced in territories. [Multiplicative]
Adds to subject liberty desire against their overlord. [Additive]
Adds to the subject liberty desire from development against their overlord. [Multiplicative]
Adds to the liberty desire subjects have against their overlord. Applied to the overlord. [Additive]
Adds to the liberty desire subjects have against their overlord if on the same continent. Applied to the overlord. [Additive]
Modifies the base effectiveness of spies against enemies. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the base effectiveness of counter-espionage against enemy spies. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the relations impact applied to a country when discovered committing an espionage action. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the effectiveness of supported rebels in other countries. [Multiplicative]
Adds to the base missionary strength against all religions. [Additive]
Adds to the base missionary strength against heretic religions. [Additive]
Adds to the base missionary count for a country. [Additive]
Adds to the base religious unity value for a country. [Additive]
Adds to the base tolerance for the true faith within a country. [Additive]
Adds to the base tolerance for heretics within a country. [Additive]
Adds to the base tolerance for heathens within a country. [Additive]
Adds to the rate of papal influence gained per year. [Additive]
Modifies the effectiveness of church power gains. [Multiplicative]
Adds to the rate of fervor gained per month. [Additive]
Modifies the rate at which harmonization occurs. [Multiplicative]
Adds to the rate of harmony gained per year. [Additive]
Adds to the rate of piety gained per month. [Additive]
Adds to the rate of karma gained per month. [Additive]
Modifies the war score cost for the Enforce Religion peace term. [Multiplicative]
Adds to the prestige bonus gained per development when successfully converting a province to a state religion. [Additive]
Modifies the war score costs for peace terms whilst in war against countries of a different religion. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the base colonist count for a country. [Additive]
Adds to the base colonial placement chance for colonists, which is the chance that additional settlers will be spawned whilst the colonist is present. [Additive]
Adds to the base yearly colonial growth gain. [Additive]
Modifies the base colonisation range, used for exploration, colonisation and coring province that border sea. [Multiplicative]
Adds to the chance of native uprisings in a colony province. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the bonus from assimilation in colonies. Native assimilation is bonus to goods produced depends on the native population. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the cooldown for the migration action for primitive nations that can migrate. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the tariff income from colonial nations. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the bonus trade power inland nodes receive from trade power sources. [Multiplicative]
Adds to the base merchant count for a country. [Additive]
Modifies the additional trade power when a merchant present in a trade node. [Additive]
Modifies the trade power in all trade nodes for a country. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the trade power for a country in trade nodes that are not domestic. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the trade power for a country in trade nodes that are domestic. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the base trade power of owned provinces. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the base trade good size of owned provinces. [Multiplicative]
Modifies a country's trade income. (Maximum is 200%) [Multiplicative]
Modifies the trade range used to determine if a country can place a merchant in a trade node. [Multiplicative]

Modifies the bonus to trade power used for steering when determining which outgoing node trade is steered to. If you have a merchant present, it also slightly increases the outgoing value. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the trade power ships grant when protecting trade. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the effectiveness of privateers in a trade node. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the effectiveness of embargoing another country. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the propagation of trade power from ships protecting trade. [Multiplicative]

Adds to the base attrition in a province. [Additive]
Adds to the base attrition for enemies in a province. [Additive]

Modifies the defensiveness of a province, impacting siege phase length. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the movement speed of units in a province that are considered friendly. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the movement speed of units in a province that are considered enemies. [Multiplicative]
Adds to the base manpower value. 1 equals 1000 men. [Additive]
Modifies the manpower efficiency in a province. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the recruitment cost of land units in a province. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the recruitment speed of land units in a province. [Multiplicative]
Adds to the base supply limit of a province. [Additive]
Modifies the supply limit efficiency of a province. [Multiplicative]
Modiifes the amount of banners that can be raised from a province. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the naval engagement width in a province. Only usable in sea provinces. [Multiplicative]
Adds to the sailors value for a province. 1 equals 1 sailor. [Additive]
Modifies the sailors efficiency of a province. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the cost of ship recruitment in a province. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the speed of ship repair in a province. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the recruitment speed of ships in a province. [Multiplicative]
Adds to the colonial growth in a colony province. [Additive]
Adds to the placement chance in a colony province. [Additive]
Adds to the base yearly inflation value. Requires every province in a country to have the modifier to work however. [Additive]
Modifies the state maintenance cost for the state that a province belongs to. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the cost of constructing buildings in a province. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the construction speed of buildings in a province. [Multiplicative]
Adds to the devastation rate in a province. [Additive]
Modifies the production efficiency in a province. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the tax efficiency in a province. [Multiplicative]
Adds to the yearly tax income of a province. [Additive]
Adds to the maximum number of building slots in a province. [Additive]
Modifies the monarch power cost for development in a province. Converts to local_tax_modifier in for non-Common Sense owners. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the spread of institutions in a province. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the cost of coring in a province. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the monarch power cost for development in a province. Does not appear or affect non-Common Sense owners. [Multiplicative]
Modifies the trade power efficiency in a province. [Multiplicative]
Adds to the trade power in a province. [Additive]
Modifies the goods produced efficiency in a province. [Multiplicative]
Adds to the trade good size in a province [Additive]
Modifies the base trade value in a province. [Multiplicative]
Adds to the base trade value in a province. [Additive]
Adds to the missionary strength in a province. 1 equals 100% strength. [Additive]
Adds to conversion resistance from Centres of Reformation. [Additive]
Modifies the culture conversion cost in a province. [Multiplicative]
Adds to the unrest value in a province. [Additive]
Adds to the autonomy rate in a province. [Additive]
Adds to the base nationalism value in a province. [Additive]
Sets the minimum autonomy value a province can have. [Constant]
Grants attack bonus in provinces with the same terrain as capital province. [Constant]
Allows units to ignore fort zones of control. [Constant]
Allows claims to be enacted through already claimed provinces. [Constant]
Grants bonus 1 tax, production and manpower on completed colonies. [Constant]
Allows usage of the Transfer Subject peace term at half cost. [Constant]
Allows usage of the force march action for free. [Constant]
Removes maintenance cost for explorers and conquisadors. [Constant]
Allows coring in any uncored province, regardless of distance. [Constant]
Acts a visible script flag. Can be checked in triggers with cb_on_government_enemies = yes [Constant]
Acts a visible script flag. Can be checked in triggers with cb_on_religious_enemies = yes [Constant]
Allows claims to be fabricated on overseas provinces in Colonial regions. [Constant]
Allows claims to be fabricated on overseas provinces in Trade Company regions. [Constant]
Allows claims to be fabricated on overseas provinces in Colonial regions that are owned by by another nation that is also overseas. [Constant]
Allows the recruitment of explorers and conquisadors. [Constant]
Allows ships to perform slave raids. [Constant]
Allows the recruitment of female generals. [Constant]
Removes the penalties associated with negative religious tolerance. [Constant]
Reduces the stability hits when taking diplomatic actions that cause them (i.e. Break Marriage). [Constant]
Allows ships to repair in coastal sea zones adjacent to owned provinces. [Constant]
Allows the usage of the Siberean Frontier mechanic. [Constant]
Grants an increase in manpower recovery by a factor of 3 during religious wars. [Constant]
Grants the abiliy to automatically discover undiscovered provinces adjacent to colonies. [Constant]
Allows the usage of Manchu banner units. Country scope. [Constant]
Allows Manchu banner units to be raised in owned provinces. Province scope. [Constant]
